awd_titl_txt: DCL: NSF INCLUDES - California STEM INCLUDES Conference and Network

por.por_cntn:
Our project, California STEM INCLUDES, convened three conferences/workshops that focused on convening the three public-sectors of higher education in California to leverage their separate expertise and create networks to support improving equity in STEM education. Two major themes emerged from the work. First, the need for an effective state-wide organization that can help coordinate the different sectors of higher education. Since our first convening, the state has established the California Learning Lab. Though not a direct outcome of the conferences, the foundation establish during the meetings played an important role in jump-starting collaborations that could be supported and coordinated by the California Learning Lab. For example, at UCI, we have been able to organize or participate in at least three California Learning Lab funded collaborations. Second, the need to reform Gateway courses in STEM, and the common themes and differences between the different sectors, emerged as a critical area. Through the conferences, we were able to connect with the Gardner Insitute and leverage their expertise and network in this effort. They provided significant support and partnerships for the final two workshops, and now a number of different California institutions are partnering or pursuing partnerships with the institute. The recent events of the COVID pandemic have highlighted more than ever the need for the connections and coordination in teaching that these conferences were able to support. This funding played a critical role in establishing a number of these partnerships and has allowed for continued improvement during these challenging times.


Last Modified: 01/31/2021
Modified by: Michael B Dennin
